page.title: 08Woodham Ferrers shopping
page.content: Supermarkets make certain items difficult to find. Also noisy. Small shops are less crowded and more personal. Supermarkets have more variety to tempt the shopper. Small shops are more fun to potter in but can be more expensive. The smaller shgops are more specialist and give advice. Most goods can be obtained under the one roof in a supermarket. Children buy items for a variety of reasons; because their friends have got them, attractive packaging, because they have seen it advertised on television or because it is new. It may be presented as something exciting to own. Collecting is also another reason. For ornaments and to adorn a bedroom. The trend appears to be for larger stores
